name: The Wyrm Cave
tagline: Paths crossed by many small rivulets, feeding a network of clear, still pools.
description: Paths crossed by many small rivulets, feeding a network of clear, still pools.

points_of_interest.name: Chasm and Lair
points_of_interest.description: A great tangle of overgrown hazels and holly in the southern reaches of this hex conceals a 60′ deep chasm, long forgotten.
points_of_interest.entering: The chasm bottom—nearly lightless in the shade of the brush overhead—narrows to a cave-like passage at one end, from which a small stream trickles.
points_of_interest.interior: The passage descends for nearly half a mile, then opens onto a cavern, 200 yards across. It is here that Chasobrithe (yellow bile wyrm—DMB) makes its lair, slumbering atop a mound of treasure and the skeletal remains and rusted armaments of some sixteen knights.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: Chasobrithe (yellow bile wyrm) makes its lair here.

npcs.name: Chasobrithe
npcs.title: Yellow Bile Wyrm
npcs.description: A yellow bile wyrm with a second, snake-necked cockerel's head growing from a scar that nearly encircles his neck.
demeanor: Lethargy quickly evaporating to calculating fury
npcs.speech: Drawn-out rasping. Woldish, Wyrm, Caprice, Sylvan, the tongue of serpents.
desires: To gather information from intruders, then eat them
secrets: Has lived in the region of Prigwort for many years
Brought great terror upon the local folk in olden times
Has lain in slumber for the past two centuries, believed dead after Sir Windlass almost decapitated him
The cockerel head grew from the near-fatal neck wound during his long repose

items.name: Shield of Sir Windlass
items.description: A 5′ tall, oblong Holy Shield (Truthful, p400) of shining steel, emblazoned with the Brackenwold coat of arms and blessed by the hand of St Willofrith. The wielder may cast the holy spell Light once per day.

items.name: Sword of Sir Windlass
items.description: A broad-bladed Fairy Longsword (Mirthful, p412) forged of a golden metal, inlaid with zigzag patterns in fairy silver.

items.name: Ivory casket
items.description: Engraved with an angelic choir. Contains a vial of Distillation of Hoarfrost (p414) and a map—annotated in Liturgic—denoting the location of the lost relics of St Jorrael (see hex 1705).

dm_notes: Intruding into the lair awakens the wyrm. Chasobrithe's cockerel head makes a bite attack each Round, inflicting 1d6 damage and petrifying any who fail a Save Versus Hold. Vulnerability: Sunlight. The Wyrm's Hoard contains: 198,033cp, 44,290sp, 12,522gp, 1,051pp; 7 hematites (10gp each), 5 bloodstones (50gp each), 5 tourmalines (100gp each), 3 blue spinels (500gp each), 4 star sapphires (1,000gp each).
